ETYMOLOGY: Late 16th century: from medieval Latin 'superintendent-', from 'superintendere' ('to oversee'), combining 'super-' (over) + 'intendere' (to direct, stretch).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who manages or directs an organization, institution, or a particular department within one, especially in the context of education or law enforcement.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 负责管理或指导一个组织、机构或其内部特定部门的人，尤其指教育或执法领域的负责人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The superintendent of the school district announced a new policy on student attendance.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 学区总监宣布了一项关于学生出勤的新政策。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In an apartment building, a person responsible for its maintenance and repairs; a building manager or custodian.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在美国公寓楼中，负责建筑维护和修理的人；大楼管理员或看管人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We called the superintendent to fix the leaky faucet in our bathroom.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们打电话给公寓管理员，让他们来修理我们浴室里漏水的水龙头。

REGISTER: Formal (for official roles), General (for building manager in US)
